meanings.definition: A secret plan by a group to do something unlawful or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The conspiracy to steal the cookies was uncovered by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The police uncovered a conspiracy to rob the bank.
meanings.sent3: The conspiracy to skip school was foiled by the principal.
meanings.sent4: The conspiracy to cheat on the test was like a shadow lurking in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The conspiracy to prank the teacher was as sneaky as a fox in the henhouse.

meanings.definition: The action of plotting or conspiring.
meanings.sent1: His conspiracy to surprise his friend with a birthday party was successful.
meanings.sent2: The conspiracy to overthrow the government was quickly stopped.
meanings.sent3: The conspiracy to sneak extra snacks into the movie theater was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The conspiracy to win the game was like a well-orchestrated symphony.
meanings.sent5: The conspiracy to paint the school mascot pink was unforgettable.
